summary: update license information prior to going open source
description: we need to add our new license to the base folder and releases add license exceptions as suggested by lawyer add third party license info and copyrights

summary: move to jpa with hibernate and annotation based mapping
description: migrated from novatec jira
original ticket from the spring version the support for the hibernate is decreasing and we should move away from hibernatetemplate to hibernate as the jpa provider
the daos should use the entitymanager interface as a standard in jee applications
in addition we need to move away from the xml mappings and change them with annotation

summary: demo inspectit monitoring for netflix rss reader
description: migrated from novatec jira
original ticket developing of a new test environment for inspectit
use the rss reader project from netflix
deploy the components in docker container and use inspectit to monitor it
put special attention on the http communication between the moduls of the rss reader and the monitoring of this communication
documentation

summary: adapt the release artifact names to a common pattern
description: the release artifact names should be in a common pattern

summary: null value in yesnodetailscellcontent when it is copied out of the detailsdialog
description: if the copy action of the is used the string which is copied to the clipboard contains null values if the yesnodetailscellcontent is used and its text is not additionally set
for example invocation sequence info children count nested sqls null nested exceptions null

summary: use fork and join technique for querying the indexing tree
description: migrated from novatec jira
originalticket since the storage is written for java as soon as we switch to it on the cmr i would propose that fork and join technique of java should be used when we query the indexing tree
the advantage should be that the separate branches that need to be queried in the same query can be processed in parallel
this would in general brings us the faster query
however there should be a selection of situations where technique should be used
it should not be used always since overhead for using it can be bigger than what we would get with parallelism more about fork join in jdk
